snippet: Josh Kilmer-Purcell, a creative director at JWT New York, came in first on the show, collecting $1 million, with his fiancé, Brent Ridge. He said he would be moving to live full time at the couple's farm, which has been the subject of another...
abstract: Josh Kilmer-Purcell, a creative director at JWT New York, came in first on the show, collecting $1 million, with his fiancé, Brent Ridge. He said he would be moving to live full time at the couple's farm, which has been the subject of another reality series, "The Fabulous Beekman Boys."

headline.main: 'Goat Farmer' With a Side Project in Advertising Wins 'Amazing Race'
